metadata.titel_preek: Smyrna: The Rich Poor Church, Part 2

dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: FAITHFULNESS IS MILITARY LOYALTY UNDER FIRE
DIVINE PROMISE IS A BUSINESS CONTRACT

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The heaviest artillery of the empire was pointed at their heads.

cognitieve_implicaties: The church is a defensive unit
The world is an active aggressor
theologische_implicaties: Suffering is not accidental but a targeted attack by evil
ethische_implicaties: Resilience and 'holding the line' are the primary virtues
onbedoelde_consequenties: Creates a 'bunker mentality' where the world is only seen as an enemy

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher uses anachronistic imagery (artillery in the 1st century) to make the ancient threat feel modern and explosive.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: The warranties and guarantees... backed up by their presence.

cognitieve_implicaties: God's word is a legal/commercial obligation he must fulfill
theologische_implicaties: The immutability of God is mapped onto business longevity
ethische_implicaties: Trust is a rational decision based on the 'track record' of the provider
onbedoelde_consequenties: Commodification of the sacred; God as a service provider

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: Uses the mundane experience of consumer frustration to explain the 'First and Last' attribute of Christ.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully bridges the historical world of Smyrna with the 20th-century experience of his hearers by using the 'Journey' and 'Business' domains to ground abstract eternity.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The sermon ends by mixing the image of a ship coming to rest with a soldier being sent out to battle.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses the physical sensation of exhaustion to bridge the metaphorical 'climb' of life with actual physical suffering.

sterktes.beschrijving: Revitalizes the 'First and Last' title by using the 'Established Business' metaphor, making an abstract title concrete for a consumer society.
sterktes.voorbeeld: We want to do business with old, established firms.

risicos.beschrijving: Mapping God's promises to business warranties risks making faith feel transactional.
risicos.voorbeeld: The warranties and guarantees that they have issued will be backed up.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Hearers may view God as a cosmic insurance agent rather than a sovereign Lord.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The ancient city of Smyrna under Roman pressure.
sub_worlds: The 20th-century commercial world (Super Bowl, business houses)
The 'endless nightmare' of the second death

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; establishes the 'Name' as the bridge across time.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By contrasting the 'hype' of the Super Bowl with the 'stability' of the First and Last.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Redefining suffering as a 'siege' or 'toiling' that God monitors.
verstoorde_schemas.vervangend_schema: Suffering as a test of faithfulness (The Crown of Life).

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Strongly aligns with the 'Communion' context mentioned in the text.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the 'Journey' and 'Conflict' domains, which is appropriate for a text on martyrdom. However, the unexpected use of the 'Economic/Business' domain provides the most cognitive 'grip' for the modern listener, even if it carries theological risks of transactionalism.

revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Describe the silence of a room where no voice ever answers.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: God as 'Business House' vs God as 'Father'
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Explicitly state that the 'warranty' is rooted in paternal love, not just contractual obligation.

entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'Gift' metaphor to ensure grace is not lost in the 'work' of holding on.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To emphasize the 'Rich' status of the 'Poor' church through the image of a hidden temple.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using CMT to bridge the 'then' and 'now' through shared embodied experiences of travel, business, and physical pain.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: While an aesthetic analysis would praise the 'alliteration' or 'rhythm,' CMT reveals how the preacher is actually re-wiring the hearer's concept of 'Eternity' using 'Business Stability' as a cognitive bridge.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Unlike Kolb's focus on the 'event' of the word, CMT shows the 'mapping' of the word into existing mental structures.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: CMT identifies that the preacher's power comes from mapping the 'First and Last' onto the 'Established Business' schema, which is the most stable schema in a capitalist society.

appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'Verticality' (reaching up to God) to critique the 'Container' (bringing God down to our level) approach to civil religion.
